channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Tuesday Briefing: Death Toll Rises in L.A. Fires
item.description: Plus, what’s going on with TV credits?

item.title: Tulip Siddiq, U.K. Anticorruption Minister, Resigns
item.description: Tulip Siddiq, the niece of former Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina of Bangladesh, had been named in an embezzlement investigation in the Asian country.

item.title: Kate Middleton, Princess of Wales, Confirms She Is in Remission from Cancer
item.description: In an Instagram post on Tuesday, she wrote: “It is a relief to now be in remission and I remain focused on recovery.”

item.title: Princess Kate’s Cancer Diagnosis: A Timeline of the Last Few Months
item.description: Catherine, the Princess of Wales, announced in March that she was being treated for an undisclosed type of cancer.

item.title: Israel and Hamas Near Agreement on Cease-Fire Deal, Qatar Says
item.description: The negotiations, mediated by Qatar, Egypt and the United States, appear to be making progress after months of failed attempts to achieve a breakthrou...

item.title: Hegseth Is Dangerous but Not for the Reasons You Think
item.description: As secretary of defense, Hegseth would channel his boss’s blend of jingoism and anger to fundamentally alter the character of the military.

item.title: How Bad is the L.A. Forecast, and When Will Firefighters Catch a Break?
item.description: The winds of another prolonged round of gusty Santa Anas were ramping up Tuesday.

item.title: Amazon’s CEO Andy Jassy has a new advisor who will join him on every meeting he has
item.description: Meet the new shadow behind Amazon’s CEO: Alex Dunlap

item.title: Israel and Hamas Near Agreement on Cease-Fire Deal, Qatar Says
item.description: The negotiations, mediated by Qatar, Egypt and the United States, appear to be making progress after months of failed attempts to achieve a breakthrou...

item.title: Elon Musk praises the ‘exponential improvement’ he’s seeing in Tesla’s full self-driving software
item.description: The Tesla CEO promises to launch a fully unsupervised version of his full self-driving software this year, but the technology is still far from mature...

item.title: Crypto sector donates cash and digital currency for LA fire relief, Blockdaemon and Ripple help lead effort
item.description: Ripple will donate $100,000 of XRP to World Central Kitchen.

item.title: Prince Harry and Meghan Markle call for Meta to reverse its decision on fact-checking, which they say was fueled by ‘ego or profit’
item.description: The royal couple has a history of being mistreated by misinformation in the media.

item.title: Kate Middleton, Princess of Wales, Confirms She Is in Remission from Cancer
item.description: In an Instagram post on Tuesday, she wrote: “It is a relief to now be in remission and I remain focused on recovery.”

item.title: Map: 6.8-Magnitude Earthquake Strikes Near Japan
item.description: View the location of the quake’s epicenter and shake area.

item.title: Walgreens CEO says anti-shoplifting strategy backfired: ‘When you lock things up…you don’t sell as many of them’
item.description: Walgreens' CEO talked about the flip side of investing in increased security on a recent earnings call.
